bib.title: TRM6/61 connects PKCα with translational control through tRNAiMet stabilization: impact on tumorigenesis
bib.author: Françoise Macari and Y El-Houfi and G Boldina and Hao Xu and S Khoury-Hanna and Jérémy Ollier and Laura Yazdani and Gang Zheng and I Bieche and Noémie Legrand and Damien Paulet and S Durrieu and A Byström and Stéphane Delbecq and Bernard Lapeyre and L Bauchet and Julie Pannequin and Frédéric Hollande and T Pan and M Teichmann and S Vagner and Alexandre David and Armelle Choquet and Dominique Joubert
bib.abstract: Accumulating evidence suggests that changes of the protein synthesis machinery alter translation of specific mRNAs and participate in malignant transformation. Here we show that protein kinase C α (PKCα) interacts with TRM61, the catalytic subunit of the TRM6/61 tRNA methyltransferase. The TRM6/61 complex is known to methylate the adenosine 58 of the initiator methionine tRNA (tRNA i Met), a nuclear post-transcriptional modification associated with the stabilization of this crucial component of the translation-initiation process. Depletion of TRM6/61 reduced proliferation and increased death of C6 glioma cells, effects that can be partially rescued by overexpression of tRNA i Met. In contrast, elevated TRM6/61 expression regulated the translation of a subset of mRNAs encoding proteins involved in the tumorigenic process and increased the ability of C6 cells to form colonies in soft agar or spheres when grown …
